alert.note: Alert for Columbus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:48AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Robeson, northwestern Columbus, southeastern Dillon and northeastern Marion Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1048 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kemper, or 8 miles southeast of Dillon, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Dillon, Mullins, Fairmont, Latta, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Boardman, Fork, Zion, Hestertown, Barnesville, Floydale, Smithboro, Kemper, Evergreen, Marietta, Proctorville, Orrum and Carolinas Hospital System - Marion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
